dict.string: The purpose of a Professional Code of Ethics includes all of the following EXCEPT one. Which one is the EXCEPTION?
To achieve high levels of practice.
To achieve high levels of integrity.
To achieve high levels of decision making.
To achieve high levels of ethical consciousness.
The purpose of a Professional code of Ethics does not include high levels of integrity. All of the other choices listed are included in the deﬁnition of a Professional Code of Ethics.
Which of the following examples of the Core Values in the Dental Hygiene Code of Ethics deals with the practitioner?
Non-maleﬁcence is a Core Value in the Dental Hygiene Code of Ethics which deals with the practitioner. This includes providing services which that protect a patient from harm.
Which of the following Core Values states that patients have a right to privacy and freedom of choice?
Autonomy is the Core Value which deals with patients and gives them the right to informed consent and full disclosure of treatment.
Providing dental screenings would be an example of which Core Value?
Beneﬁcence is the Core Value that includes promoting the well-being of individuals and the public.
Which of the following is the best way to avoid a dental lawsuit?
Veriﬁcation of treatment plan by dentist.
The best way to avoid a dental lawsuit is through proper documentation, charting and communication.
Placing a sealant on a child's tooth without getting parental consent is an example of:

Battery is deﬁned as causing an individual bodily harm. Dental procedures which have been performed without the approval of the patient or guardian, although beneﬁcial, are considered "bodily harm". Assault is threatening bodily harm.
Which of the following is OSHA NOT responsible for?
OSHA is responsible for developing precautionary protocols for employees to prevent them from harm. It does NOT include the employer.
COBRA (Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act) gives individuals the right to keep group health insurance beneﬁts for:
The guidelines for COBRA give individuals the right to keep group health insurance beneﬁts for 18 months if a person has reduced work hours, quits, or is ﬁred from his job.
All of the following are true about Informed Consent EXCEPT one. Which one is the EXCEPTION?

Informed consent includes the following: 1) presented in understandable language; 2) nature and need of procedure; 3) beneﬁts/ risks of procedure; 4) prognosis; 5) alternatives to procedure; 6) allowing the patient to ask questions. The cost of the procedure is not included with informed consent.
The Statute of Limitations for a dental law suit is:
Because dental lawsuits vary from state to state and type of oﬀense, there is NO deﬁnite time for a universal statute of limitations.
